definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

sentences.english: Tassels on the horns of a dilemma, back to the husbands family and no steps, had to find treasure complex complaint.
sentences.chinese: 流苏进退两难，回婆家又没台阶，只得找宝络诉苦。

sentences.english: Teachers are indeed caught in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 老师确实陷入进退两难的境地。

sentences.english: So Kay has been in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 所以，Kay陷入了进退两难的窘境。
也有许多人都面临着这样的进退两难的处境。

sentences.english: Wang Fang found herself in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 王芳发现自己陷入了进退两难的地步。

sentences.english: Facing such an outright sexual harassment, the student found herself in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 该女博士生面对这种公然的性骚扰，感到进退两难。

sentences.english: If bricks can be some thing, what about you?
sentences.chinese: 做事不能进退两难，想清楚，不能做墙头草。

sentences.english: It was precisely at this juncture that the boss found himself in A dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 恰恰在这个时候老板发现了自己处在进退两难的境地。

sentences.english: The stage's in a dilemma, easy or difficult, it looks the same.
sentences.chinese: 进退两难的阶段，说易说难也是相对。

sentences.english: Faced with that dilemma, he was perplexed.
sentences.chinese: 他面对进退两难的局面，不知如何是好。

sentences.english: Spinning mills, which turn raw-cotton into yarn, are caught in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 把原棉制作成纱线的纺纱厂目前的处境可谓进退两难。

sentences.english: Germany, therefore, finds itself in something of a Catch-22.
sentences.chinese: 德国，因此发现自己处于一个进退两难的境地。

sentences.english: So it really is a dilemma which has to be solved collectively.
sentences.chinese: 所以这真是进退两难，需要合力解决。

sentences.english: Governments are caught in a vise.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府现在真是进退两难了。

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
dilemma/quandary/to face a difficult choice
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
dilemma/quandary/Scylla and Charybdis/between the devil and the deep blue sea (idiom)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
isolated and without help
circumstances
awkward situation/predicament
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
